intro: Cyrtandra weberi, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a broad, ovate shape with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra weberi plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
